alert.note: Alert for Cherry; Grant; Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 23 at 9:56PM CDT until June 23 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Cherry County in north central Nebraska... Northwestern Grant County in west central Nebraska... Southeastern Sheridan County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... * Until 945 PM MDT. * At 856 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 20 miles north of Ashby, or 35 miles southeast of Rushville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Watson Lake, Bingham, Big Hill, Dipping Vat Meadow, Morgan Lake, Billys Lake, Wolf Hill, Finnegan Lake, Intersection of Highway 61 and Survey Valley Road, Argo Hill and Mother Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 128 and 136. Highway 61 between mile markers 171 and 186. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for the Panhandle of, north central and west central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for the Panhandle of, north central and west central Nebraska.
